name: Archmage
description: An Archmage is a figure of immense magical power who wears ornate robes and often wields a staff. They possess exceptional intelligence, typically adorned with symbols of their magical sophistication.
memorable: Archmages are known for their ability to bend reality through powerful spells, including devastating area attacks and defensive magic that can alter the flow of battle.
goals: Archmages seek knowledge and power, often influencing political matters in the magical and mundane worlds. They may pursue personal ambitions or serve as guardians of magical knowledge.
relations: Archmages frequently have apprentices and may be associated with schools or councils of magic. They can also be familiar with other powerful beings and creatures of magic.
environment: Archmages often reside in secluded towers or magical academies, surrounded by wards and guardians to protect their secrets.
strengths: With high Intelligence and access to powerful spells, Archmages excel in spellcasting and battlefield control. They have resistance to magic and can protect themselves from psychic attacks.
weaknesses: Despite their magical prowess, Archmages may lack physical resilience and can be vulnerable to direct attacks if caught unprepared.
attacks: Archmage attacks include both physical strikes with a dagger and explosive spell casts like Lightning Bolt and Fire Bolt that deal significant elemental damage.
most_powerful_ability: The ability to cast spells such as Globe of Invulnerability prevents others' lower-level spells from affecting the Archmage, making them a formidable opponent.
equipment: Archmages typically carry staffs or magical artifacts to enhance their spellcasting abilities.
senses: The Archmage has a passive Perception of 16, demonstrating keen awareness.
skills: The Archmage is proficient in Arcana and History, reflecting their vast magical knowledge and scholarly pursuits.
additional_information: Magic Resistance grants them advantage on saving throws against spells.
Mind Blank provides immunity to psychic damage and prevents mind reading.
Foresight ability gives them advantage on various checks and imposes disadvantage on attackers.
Can cast powerful spells such as Teleport and Cone of Cold.
Ability to teleport using Shimmering Step for quick repositioning.
spellcasting: The Archmage is an 18th-level spellcaster with a spell save DC of 17, capable of casting a wide array of spells for offensive, defensive, and utility purposes.
